Text: Tencent revealed the real number of deaths.
Explanation: The screenshot is questionable.

Text: Taking chlorine dioxide helps fight coronavirus.
Explanation: Chlorine dioxide does guard against the coronavirus or against other diseases and is harmful.

Text: This video shows workmen uncovering a bat-infested roof in the US state of Florida in 2011.
Explanation: A video shows bats nesting in the roof; however, the claim is misleading because it has been circulating the internet since July 2011 and actually shows repairs being made to the roof because of a bat-infested house in Miami

Text: The Asterix comic books and The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
Explanation: Coronavirus has been around since the 1960s. The Simpsons image was edited.

Text: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited a mosque amid the coronavirus outbreak and asked the people of the Muslim community to pray about present crisis.
Explanation: Chinese President Xi Jinping's visit to the mosque is not related to coronavirus. The video is nearly four years old.

Text: China seeks court approval to kill over 20,000 coronavirus patients to stop the spread of the outbreak.
Explanation: There is no evidence that China went to courts seeking such approval.

Text: A video shows people screaming in Wuhan because they feared the coronavirus.
Explanation: The video shows Wuhan residents whistling and shouting to commemorate Dr. Li Wenliang, the whistleblower of the virus who died on 2/7/20 after getting infected.

Text: A video says weed kills coronavirus.
Explanation: The news clip was created through a meme generator. The WHO has stated there are no cures for the virus.

Text: Coronavirus has been found in broiler chicken.
Explanation: The claim is fake.

Text: In a photo of Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan and Chinese President Xi Jinping, Imran Khan is wearing a mask.
Explanation: The image was edited.

Text: Autopsy reveals a Wuhan doctor was murdered in his sickbed.
Explanation: There is no source cited in this report. Other news outlets confirmed Li Wenliang died from the coronavirus.

Text: The new coronavirus "causes sudden death syndrome."¬ù
Explanation: There is no evidence the virus causes sudden death syndrome.

Text: Coronavirus is caused by snakes.
Explanation: There is no proof that snakes have caused the spread of the new coronavirus.

Text: Can cannabis cure coronavirus?
Explanation: There is no government mandate, research or WHO comments supporting cannabis as a cure for coronavirus.

Text: A woman infected with the coronavirus was killed by Chinese police.
Explanation: The woman in the video was taken into custody for violating traffic restrictions in China's Heilongjiang province.

Text: Garlic water can cure novel coronavirus.
Explanation: Garlic may have some antimicrobial properties. There is no evidence that eating garlic has protected people from the new coronavirus.

Text: Coronavirus is found in broiler chicken.
Explanation: There is no evidence to prove that coronavirus is found in the broiler chickens. The WHO has clarified that meat cooked properly can be consumed.

Text: Bill Gates predicted coronavirus.
Explanation: Bill Gates didn't predict coronavirus 2019-nCoV

Text: Bill Gates predicted coronavirus.
Explanation: Bill Gates did not predict the new coronavirus.

Text: In 2012, a Facebook user predicted coronavirus from China.
Explanation: The Facebook status wasn't original. It was modified on the 1/27/20.

Text: There is a case of coronavirus in Caserta.
Explanation: There is no case of coronavirus in Caserta as of 2/10/20

Text: COVID-19 was stolen from Canada by Chinese spies and accidentally released in Wuhan.
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

Text: There is a case of coronavirus in Andorra.
Explanation: There is no case of coronavirus in Andorra as of 2/10/20.

Text: A child from China has coronavirus in Galicia, Spain.
Explanation: There are no children infected with coronavirus in Spain at this date, 2/10/20.

Text: A person with coronavirus is in Andorra on 2/10/20.
Explanation: As of 2/10/20, there is no confirmed case of coronavirus in Andorra.

Text: Satellite images show high levels of sulphur dioxide above China are possible evidence of mass cremations of people who have died from coronavirus.
Explanation: The maps are not satellite images, and do not show actual levels of sulphur dioxide. They are forecasts based on historical data and weather patterns.

Text: Pets can contaminate humans.
Explanation: According to the WHO, there is no evidence that dogs or cats can be infected with the new coronavirus. French medical experts confirm that a virus crossing the species barrier is rare.

Text: People are lying on the ground in China because they contracted the coronavirus.
Explanation: Video comes from South Africa during a initiation rite at a private school.

Text: Cats and dogs can be infected and can contaminate humans with COVID-19.
Explanation: There is no evidence that dogs or cats can be infected with the new coronavirus, according to the WHO and French medical experts.

Text: Cats and dogs can be infected and can contaminate humans with COVID-19.
Explanation: There is no evidence that pets such as dogs or cats can be infected with the new coronavirus, say WHO and French medical experts.

Text: Coronavirus-infected chicken has been found in Bengaluru, India.
Explanation: The image is outdated and not related to coronavirus.

Text: Videos state that 25,000 Chinese are being killed.
Explanation: Three different videos -- two unrelated to the coronavirus and one with overlaid music -- are combined with false claims.

Text: People in Wuhan are locked inside their houses by the Chinese government.
Explanation: The video shows people in Wuhan offering their respects to the whistleblower, Dr. Li Wenliang.

Text: "Breaking
Explanation: Only about a dozen coronavirus cases have been confirmed in the United Kingdom as of 2/11/20.

Text: The coronavirus epidemic will disappear in April thanks to the heat, as President Donald Trump said.
Explanation: It's impossible to predict the evolution of the epidemic because this coronavirus is a new strain. Weather probably plays a role, but it remains to be determined.

Text: Police publicly kill a coronavirus-infected woman in China.
Explanation: The video is not related to coronavirus. The woman in the video was taken into custody for violating traffic restrictions in China's Heilongjiang province.

Text: "THE CHINESE HAVE BEGUN TO USE THEIR HUMAN CORPSE TO PROCESS INTO PRODUCTS SUCH AS CORNED BEEF TO SHIP TO AFRICA. Please share with your contacts. Very important"¬ù
Explanation: The video might be of Tibet or China's Sichuan as residents of both these territories perform such rituals. However, it is unknown if the visuals in this video belong to Sky Burial. The video is not related to the coronavirus outbreak.

Text: China is seeking court's approval to kill 20,000 people positive with coronavirus
Explanation: There is no evidence for the claim that the Chinese court had ordered to kill the 20,000 patients affected with coronavirus.

Text: China seeks court's approval to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients.
Explanation: The post is false.

Text: Hand sanitizer form 2010 is labeled against COVID-19.
Explanation: The hand sanitizer marked in 2010 was designed for general coronavirus and is now related to COVID-19.

Text: China orders citizens to abandon/kill their pets as they can transmit coronavirus.
Explanation: Several state outlets have asked citizens not to abandon their pets. There is no evidence local authorities are ordering the killing of pets.

Text: Vitamin C and Omega prevent the new coronavirus.
Explanation: They cannot prevent coronavirus infection.

Text: Germans quarantined in La Gomera by the coronavirus leave home isolation without permission.
Explanation: The Ministry of Health of the Canary Islands denies they have returned to Germany.

Text: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.
Explanation: Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.
Origin: Andrew W. Saul, Orthomolecular Medicine News Service

Text: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.
Explanation: Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.
Origin: Andrew W. Saul, Orthomolecular Medicine News Service

Text: Coronavirus cases reported in Rome, Georgia.
Explanation: The medical facility issued a statement saying there was no confirmed case.

Text: Silver Solution used on strains of coronavirus "totally eliminates it. Kills it. Deactivates it."¬ù
Explanation: There are no remedies that cure any strain of human coronavirus including COVID-19. Sellman's "silver solution" and colloidal silver can be harmful.

Text: Bats responsible for the outbreak of coronavirus originated from the rooftop of a house in Wuhan.
Explanation: The video is about nine years old and is from Miami, USA.

Text: Weed kills the coronavirus.
Explanation: Weed does not kill the coronavirus.

Text: COVID-19 was caused by 5G antennas.
Explanation: There is no proof the 5G network is related to the outbreak of novel coronavirus.

Text: Satellite images showing high levels of sulphur dioxide above China are possible evidence of mass cremations of people who have died from coronavirus.
Explanation: This is a forecast based on historical data.

Text: Using cocaine kills the coronavirus
Explanation: There's no scientific evidence to support this theory. In fact, there is still no cure for the COVID-19.

Text: The Chinese news website Tencent filters that there are more than 24,000 deaths from coronavirus.
Explanation: Tencent denied that information and said doctored images circulated on social media featuring false information they never published

Text: Claims of cannibalism in China
Explanation: The image shows an autopsy on a baby.

Text: This is a person with coronavirus in Calella, Barcelona (2/13/20).
Explanation: This is denied by health authorities.

Text: Sulfur dioxide pollution in Wuhan reveals that China is burning bodies of victims.
Explanation: The map is not a real-time air quality report, but a forecast based on past datas, which therefore cannot take account of alleged recent events.

Text: China orders citizens to abandon/kill their pets as they can transmit coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no proof that Chinese authorities have ordered the killing of pets. There is proof that some Chinese authorities have approved killings of stray dogs and cats in order to stop the spread of the virus. The WHO says there is no evidence that the virus can be transmitted through pets.

Text: Coronavirus was created in a lab in Wuhan.
Explanation: No scientific evidence supports that the coronavirus was created in a lab. According to the WHO, "Both Chinese and external expert groups are working in trying to identify the animal source of this new virus."¬ù

Text: People in Wuhan are locked inside their houses trying to escape a building fire.
Explanation: The fire was caused by faulty electrical wiring. The video is not related to COVID-19.

Text: The WHO declared COVID-19 is the abbreviation for China Outbreak Virus in December 2019.
Explanation: The WHO declared the official name of coronavirus as COVID-19, which stands for coronavirus disease.

Text: A video shows police killing COVID-19 affected people in China.
Explanation: The video was edited with three unrelated clips. Yiwu Police have clarified that the armed police in the video were on duty to kill a rabid dog. The last clip is related to an accident.

Text: Chicken infected from coronavirus found In Bangalore.
Explanation: The image is old and not related to the 2019 novel coronavirus.

Text: Video of police killing COVID-19 affected people in China.
Explanation: The video was edited with three unrelated clips. Yiwu Police have clarified that the armed police in the video were on duty to kill a rabid dog. The last clip is related to an accident.

Text: A video shows a Chinese epidemiologist saying there are millions of people infected.
Explanation: The epidemiologist said if the Chinese Government had not taken action, there would be millions infected by the coronavirus.

Text: This photo is a "chinese tapa"¬ù?from a bat.
Explanation: The photo is not of a Chinese dish, but of a soup from Guam island (United States).

Text: A residential building was set on fire in Wuhan to control spread of coronavirus.
Explanation: A fire broke out in a different city in China, and officials said the fire had no connection to the coronavirus outbreak.

Text: High-rise buildings have become human incinerators to combat the spread of the coronavirus.
Explanation: There was no concrete evidence to prove that buildings were being burned to stop coronavirus. The source is not credible.

Text: New confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Kolkatta reported by Press Trust of India.
Explanation: There are no confirmed coronavirus patients in Kolkata, as confirmed both by the airport authority of Kolkata and the Traveller.

Text: High levels of sulfur dioxide in Wuhan "may be a sign of mass cremations of victims of the coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: The photo shows sulfur dioxide projections. It is not a real-time satellite image.

Text: China has announced the sucess of Egyptian serum form Dr. Hala, Ealth Miniter of Egypt, against coronavirus
Explanation: WHO says there is no known cure of vaccine to the coronavirus for now.

Text: China has announced the success of Egyptian serum form Dr. Hala, Health Minister of Egypt, against coronavirus
Explanation: The WHO says there is no known cure or vaccine for the coronavirus at this time.

Text: There is a COVID-19 case in east Indian state.
Explanation: The local health authority said there are no confirmed novel coronavirus patients in the area as of 2/17/20.

Text: Bus driver in China vomits blood after becoming unconscious behind the wheel.
Explanation: The video dates back to 2015 when a driver in Xiamen, China, was suffering from gastrointestinal bleeding.

Text: A video shows a massive explosion in Wuhan, China, to control the spread of coronavirus.
Explanation: The video dates back to 2015 when there were giant explosions at the Chinese port of Tianjin. The video has no connection with coronavirus.

Text: Black skin is resistant to coronavirus.
Explanation: There's no scientific evidence to support this theory and experts have already denied it.

Text: Consuming magnesium chloride, sodium bicarbonate, ginger and lemon juice prevents coronavirus infection.
Explanation: No health organization has recommended consuming these products to prevent coronavirus.

Text: Latest research by Chinese scientists said coronavirus will render most male patients infertile.
Explanation: The study has not been peer-reviewed and does not say coronavirus will definitely cause infertility in men.

Text: This bottle of disinfectant gel proves that the coronavirus existed before 2019.
Explanation: Different strains of coronavirus existed years before COVID-19, which explains why the term "coronavirus" is written on the bottle.

Text: The coronavirus outbreak in Georgia is caused by the EU-Georgia Association Agreement.
Explanation: Scientists agree that the SARS-CoV-2 is not a man-made virus and it originated in animals - most likely in bats.

Text: Drinking alcohol kills the coronavirus.
Explanation: Drinking alcohol does not cure coronavirus. Alcohol in sanitizers does have an effect on the virus.

Text: Seven children died from coronavirus within one week in Karimganj (Assam, India).
Explanation: Public health officials have denied any coronavirus deaths. The children died in a span of two months due to fever and other illnesses.

Text: Cocaine kills the coronavirus.
Explanation: This post is fake.

Text: Data shows a massive release of sulfur dioxide gas near Wuhan.
Explanation: The images are not satellite measurements, and a member of NASA said the images did not show a significant increase in SO2 measurements.

Text: Popping bubble wrap exposes people to coronavirus.
Explanation: Bubble wrap is not produced by people blowing air into the plastic.The claim is false.

Text: 20 million Chinese people converted to Islam after it was proven that the coronavirus does not affect Muslims.
Explanation: Video shows Chinese converting to Islam before the first reported case in Wuhan in 2019.

Text: This video shows corpses on the streets of Wuhan.
Explanation: The video of Shenzhen shows people from Hubei sleeping in the streets because no one wants to rent them a roll.

Text: Chinese police kill a woman escaping a COVID-19 quarantine in China.
Explanation: The scene shows a motorbike accident.

Text: India has developed a treatment for coronavirus.
Explanation: India has not developed a treatment.

Text: Chinese are converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVID-19 in the country.
Explanation: The viral video is old and not related to coronavirus.

Text: China seeks court's approval to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients.
Explanation: The claim is fake.

Text: This coronavirus-infected patient reached to Dr. Vinod Kumar but he wasn't given the treatment. He was later referred to Bhagalpur. It further states that one should avoid meat and fish for 3 months and wear mask to protect yourself from coronavirus.
Explanation: The post claiming that coronavirus infected patient reached Bihar and is not given treatment is fake. Health authorities dismiss the hoax report. Further, WHO has also not recommended to avoid fish and meat. It recommended thoroughly cooking meat and eggs. Wearing mask is, however, advisable.

Text: World labs confirm coronavirus was bioengineered.
Explanation: There is no evidence of this.

Text: An elderly Chinese couple infected with coronavirus say goodbye while they are in a hospital.
Explanation: The elderly couple was hospitalized for other conditions including lung cancer and respiratory failure.

Text: Coronavirus is a biological warfare weapon.
Explanation: Dr. Francis Boyle said coronavirus is a biological warfare weapon, but there is no context or supporting evidence. It was debunked as a rumor.

Text: The 2008 book "End of Days"¬ù predicted the current coronavirus outbreak.
Explanation: Dean Koontz, not Sylvia Browne, wrote about "Wuhan-400"¬ù.

Text: A video says "the coronavirus was invented and patented in the USA and then planted in China."¬ù
Explanation: There is no evidence the coronavirus was "invented."¬ù

Text: Studies show the coronavirus was engineered to be a bioweapon.
Explanation: The same studies show how coronavirus strains have an evolutionary, not engineered, relationship.

Text: Chinese converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVD19 in the country.
Explanation: The video has been available since June 2019 and has no relation to the current outbreak of coronavirus in China.

Text: A Chinese man has been lynched because he pretended to have the coronavirus.
Explanation: The man was Philippine, not Chinese. He was lynched because other people thought he could spread the coronavirus in their city.

Text: The drug Arbidol can help fight the new coronavirus.
Explanation: The drug Arbidol (also known as Umifenovir) is a cure for coronavirus.

Text: 20 million Chinese convert to Islam, and coronavirus does not affect Muslims.
Explanation: The video doesn't feature Chinese people, but rather Filipino men. Video footage predates major coronavirus reports.

Text: The Simpsons predicted the new coronavirus outbreak.
Explanation: An image from the show was altered to read "coronavirus."

Text: Video shows racist reactions toward Asian people.
Explanation: They are actors.

Text: Coronavirus has arrived in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Explanation: There is no confirmation of this information.

Text: Chinese people are fleeing China to Vietnam because of coronavirus.
Explanation: People are going from Vietnam to China for work.

Text: Six coronavirus cases confirmed in Wichita, Kansas.
Explanation: No cases have been confirmed there as of 2/21/20.

Text: Pigs are buried alive due to coronavirus.
Explanation: The video is not recent and has nothing to do with coronavirus.

Text: Post says "people of color may be immune to the coronavirus because of melanin."¬ù
Explanation: Melanin is a natural pigment that gives color to skin and eyes. It does not make you any less susceptible to the coronavirus.

Text: According to a study the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 was the result of experiements done in a lab located near the market in Wuhan.
Explanation: The hypothesis that SARS-CoV-2 is a lab made virus in the context presented by the articles in question is based on an opinion piece that does not constitute a scientific study. All the evidence thus far suggest that the new coronavirus was the result of natural mutation.
Origin: Various local news sites and blogs

Text: A Facebook status from 2012 talked about the spread of coronavirus in 2020.
Explanation: The Facebook status was updated on 1/27/20.

Text: Years ago, there was a hand sanitizer active against Sars-Cov-2.
Explanation: The hand sanitizer is active against coronavirus in general. There is no specific sanitizer against Sars-Cov-2, according to the manufacturing company.

Text: Bill Gates wrote a letter saying COVID-19 is teaching humans a lesson.
Explanation: The story was retracted and the letter was fake.

Text: The link between COVID-19 and 5G is being hidden.
Explanation: The link does not exist.

Text: Coronavirus case in Uttar Pradesh district, India.
Explanation: Authorities deny there is a case.

Text: A Chinese SWAT Team takes down a coronavirus suspect
Explanation: A mock drill video was shared as China committing atrocities on its patients.

Text: There are two coronavirus cases in Bovalino (Reggio Calabria, Italy).
Explanation: There are no cases as of 2/24/20.

Text: Coronavirus in Sant'Egidio (Abruzzo, Italy).
Explanation: There are no cases as of 2/24/20.

Text: Coronavirus in Parabiago e Nerviano (Lombardia, Italy)
Explanation: There are no cases as of 2/24/20.

Text: Coronavirus is present at Bosch company in Bari (Puglia) because Chinese people visited the week before.
Explanation: There are no cases as of 2/24/20.

Text: A book by D.Koontz, "The Eyes of Darkness,"¬ù predicted COVID-19 in 1981.
Explanation: The first edition of the book mentioned the (imaginary) virus was invented by the Russians, not the Chinese.

Text: Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus.
Explanation: The predictions of Nostradamus are not correctly translated. Even if Nostradamus truly predicted a "plague," the title says it is taking place in a seaside town. The coronavirus originated in the city of Wuhan, China, which is not a seaside town.

Text: A 1981 book predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
Explanation: The book does talk about a virus called Wuhan-400, but it's not the same as COVID-19.

Text: Radio host Rush Limbaugh compares novel coronavirus to "the common cold."¬ù
Explanation: Experts say the new coronavirus is more deadly than the viruses that can cause a cold.

Text: "The coronavirus is the common cold, folks."¬ù
Explanation: The 2019 coronavirus is a new virus that had not been previously identified.

Text: Video says President Donald Trump spawned the "Wuhan super virus outbreak under code name 'zyphr.'"¬ù
Explanation: There is no evidence that President Trump had anything to do with the creation of the coronavirus.

Text: Coronavirus was found in horses.
Explanation: Technically true since horses can be infected with a coronavirus, but not the SARS-CoV-2.

Text: Indian Government and the WHO advised people not to purchase colors from China for Holi.
Explanation: No such advisory was shared by the government or the Ministry.

Text: China needs coronavirus SWAT (special weapons and tactics) police teams to arrest this coronavirus victim.
Explanation: Video shows a mock drill by Tongbai police practicing to take down coronavirus infected patients if they are uncooperative.

Text: In Poland, people who are not insured have to pay for coronavirus testing, so if they can't afford it, they will spread it.
Explanation: Anyone who is suspected of having coronavirus will have a medical examination free of charge, regardless of insurance.

Text: Bats that hide under Wuhan rooftops caused the COVID-19 outbreak.
Explanation: The video was filmed in Miami in 2011.

Text: Video of a road traffic control in China to detect people infected with coronavirus.
Explanation: The video was filmed in China, and is a simulation, not a real incident.

Text: Bats that hide under Wuhan rooftops caused the COVID-19 outbreak.
Explanation: The video was recorded in the U.S. in 2011.

Text: Coronavirus is a bioweapon leaked from a Wuhan lab.
Explanation: Scientists in Wuhan insist there are no links between the virus and labs.

Text: Coronavirus patients are being "cremated alive"¬ù in China.
Explanation: The Chinese government has ordered the swift cremation of patients who die after contracting the coronavirus. There is no evidence they are being cremated alive.

Text: Evidence indicates COVID-19 escaped a Chinese lab that was researching it, causing the outbreak.
Explanation: Multiple scientific studies have indicated the virus has a natural origin, and is not the result of human engineering.
Origin: Steven W. Mosher, New York Post

Text: The mortality rate for the flu is "right around"¬ù that of the new coronavirus
Explanation: The mortality rate for the flu is considered by most experts to be about 0.1%. Estimates for the mortality rate for coronavirus are currently around 2%, but this number could change depending on how cases are diagnosed.

Text: President Trump claims the virus is under control and testing is available.
Explanation: This information from the president over two months has been confusing and contradictory.

Text: China took advantage of the coronavirus crisis to buy back stocks from its technology companies belonging to foreign investors.
Explanation: There is no evidence to support the claims in this story, published in 2014. It was not the Chinese but the Russian president at the time, and the emergency was not the coronavirus. The country, the president, the currency and the reason for the emergency were changed.

Text: Is it useful to close borders to stop the outbreak?
Explanation: French medical experts say closing borders in order to prevent infected people from entering in France is ineffective. Health tests before entering the country have little effect.

Text: Italian Red Cross gives the recipe for making amuchina (hand sanitizer) at home.
Explanation: Italian Red Cross has never shared such a recipe. It could be useful only to disinfect vegetables.

Text: A "letter"¬ù from an uncle in Wuhan claims COVID-19 can be cured with hot water.
Explanation: There is no evidence hot water can cure COVID-19, other facts stated in the said letter are also inaccurate.

Text: A man is allegedly selling medical masks for 80 denars on a bus owned by the Skopje Public Transportation Enterprise.
Explanation: The photo has also been posted on the Facebook page of the site 3minute.net on 2/25/20. According to the status, the photo was taken in the town of Craiova, Romania, and not in Skopje, North Macedonia.

Text: Letters and packages sent from China can cause coronavirus infection.
Explanation: Though some viruses can live for some time on objects like door knobs, the WHO says the new coronavirus cannot live very long in envelopes and boxes.

Text: Face masks are a good protection against the coronavirus.
Explanation: Masks are a reliable means of protection only if you are a health professional or are in contact with somebody who is infected.

Text: The new coronavirus was registered in 2004.
Explanation: It was another type of coronavirus that was registered in 2004, not the one that caused the current outbreak.

Text: School has been suspended in Catalonia until 3/2/20.
Explanation: The Catalonian education department did not make this statement

Text: New cases of coronavirus in Madrid are linked to two universities and a club.
Explanation: The photos about coronavirus were manipulated.

Text: Two cases are confirmed of coronavirus in Huelva, Andaluc¬°a (2/26/20)
Explanation: The Andalusian health ministry said there are no coronavirus infections in the Spanish region as of 2/2/6/20.

Text: A monkey has been infected with coronavirus in this photo.
Explanation: The photo is a capture of a video taken at least two months before the first cases of COVID-19.

Text: CDC issued facial hair recommendation for novel coronavirus prevention.
Explanation: Graphic is more than two years old and unrelated to the current outbreak.

Text: A post say "hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.

Text: Hair Weaves And Lace Front Wigs Made In China Likely To Contain coronavirus.
Explanation: There is very little chance of coronavirus spreading this way, and there have not been any reported cases of this happening.

Text: A post says "hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.

Text: "Coronavirus
Explanation: The screenshot of "breaking news"¬ù is originally from a satirical news site. A news generator watermark is visible in the top right corner, which means the image was created.

Text: The CDC recommends men shave their beards to protect against coronavirus.
Explanation: A 2017 CDC infographic shows how facial hair could interfere with respirator masks. The graphic is unrelated to coronavirus protection and the CDC has not recommended shaving beards to ward off the virus.

Text: Cocaine kills the coronavirus.
Explanation: Fake story was generated by a website that allows people to create their own news stories. This is a previously disproved claim.

Text: "Hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.

Text: Health authorities say shaving a beard protects from COVID-19.
Explanation: It's a 2017 graphic about how professionals should wear tight-fitting masks.

Text: Chloroquine cures COVID-19.
Explanation: Chloroquine showed signs is not a cure for COVID-19.

Text: French far right leader Marine Le Pen says the EU didn't act against the outbreak
Explanation: The EU has activated the civil protection mechanism, launched aid programs, mobilized funds for research and called for more international cooperation and coordination.

Text: The WHO says the coronavirus might be spread by food.
Explanation: The WHO has no evidence that infections from food are possible.

Text: The WHO has issued an alert against buying holy colors from China
Explanation: The WHO hasn't issued an advisory against buying Holi colors from coronavirus-hit China. The claim is fake.

Text: A video accompanying a claim shows bodies being removed from a hospital in Iran during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explanation: The claim is false. The video has circulated since August 2019 and depicts a funeral procession for pilgrims who died during the annual Islamic pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia's Grand Mosque.

Text: Video shows Chinese officials detaining an infected citizen who refused to be tested.
Explanation: The video shows an exercise, not a real event.

Text: A "Lithuanian doctor"¬ù gives advice to those potentially infected with the coronavirus.
Explanation: The information is false since instructions to stay at home if infected were not given out by any of the authorities.

Text: A monkey is been infected with the coronavirus in this photo.
Explanation: The photo is a capture of a video taken at least two months before the first COVID-19 symptoms were experienced.

Text: Lectures have been suspended at the University of Sevilla due to coronavirus.
Explanation: The university stated the document is false.

Text: There is a new case of COVID-19 in Saced¬¢n (Spain).
Explanation: The town office denied the claim.

Text: El Pais said there is a possible case of coronavirus at the hospital Gregorio Mara¬§¬¢n in Spain.
Explanation: El Pa¬°s has not published that article and the typography doesn't match.

Text: An article in El Pais says there is a case of coronavirus at the School of Architecture of Madrid.
Explanation: El Pa¬°s did not publish this article.

Text: First case of coronavirus in Alcal¬† de Henares (Madrid).
Explanation: One screenshot shows a false article created in an app; the other has not been published by El Mundo newspaper.

Text: A brothel with 86 customers was quarantined after a prostitute tested positive for the coronavirus.
Explanation: This was a satirical comment.

Text: Sevilla's university has suspended classes because of coronavirus on 2/27/20.
Explanation: The university denied this claim on its Twitter account.

Text: Dr. Gerardo Dovakin found a vaccine against coronavirus.
Explanation: Dovakin is an actor, not a doctor.

Text: A book published in 1981 said that in 2020 a severe pneumonia-like illness would spread across the world, and calling it "Wuhan-400"¬ù.
Explanation: These lines are from two different books

Text: Each side of protective surgical masks has different functions, indicated by colour, and you should choose the way you wear by whether you are ill or not.
Explanation: This is incorrect. Generally, if they have a coloured side, you should wear your mask with this pointing outward"?but always read the manufacturer's instructions to be sure.

Text: Lysol products can kill the novel coronavirus.
Explanation: While Lysol products are advertised to kill 99.9% of bacteria and viruses, including coronavirus, the company is referring to previous strains of the virus. There is no known cure for the novel coronavirus strain.

Text: "The blood test for coronavirus costs $3,200."¬ù
Explanation: The CDC isn't charging for coronavirus testing but patients could be stuck with associated costs, such as a trip to the emergency room. In Florida, a man who worried he was infected initially faced a $3,270 bill even though he never received a coronavirus test.

Text: "¬ùAmerica has been vaccinating cattle for coronavirus for years, yet the news tells you it's new and going to kill you all, so go buy a mask."¬ù
Explanation: The vaccine for cattle won't help humans and won't protect against this new form of coronavirus.

Text: Starting in March, if you travel outside of the United States you won't be allowed back in the country "due to high risk of the coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: As of 3/6/20, there is no mandate that states Americans are barred from returning to the U.S. from anywhere overseas.

Text: "'Akira' is a 1988 movie about an apocalyptic event taking place months before Tokyo 2020 Olympics, showing the WHO advising Japan to postpone the Olympics because of a pandemic risk."¬ù
Explanation: The movie does not include a pandemic and the WHO is never mentioned.

Text: Beef meat is the best vaccine against COVID-19.
Explanation: There is no evidence to prove this.

Text: Chinese police use a fishing net to arrest a man with a high fever.
Explanation: The video shows a police training exercise.

Text: COVID-19 is just a big flu.
Explanation: It is too early to make this assumption. Statistics show COVID-19 is not a generic virus.

Text: It is best to shave your beard to avoid being infected by the coronavirus.
Explanation: Unless you are in contact with people infected by the virus at work, there is no need to shave your beard.

Text: The German government made a "secret plan"¬ù about coronavirus in 2012 that foretold the pandemic.
Explanation: There is no secret plan but a public risk assessment of the German government in 2012 contained a hypothetical epidemic of a fictional coronavirus named Modi-SARS.

Text: Tips against coronavirus like holding your breath and drinking water.
Explanation: These tips don't prevent infection with coronavirus.

Text: Coronavirus patients in China are caught by officials on a highway.
Explanation: The video shows a mock drill. The China SWAT team in the video is "practicing" how to deal with coronavirus patients.

Text: Coronavirus patients in China are caught by officials on a highway.
Explanation: The video shows a mock drill. The China SWAT team in the video is "practicing" how to deal with coronavirus patients.

Text: A video of chaos in a shop claims people are panicking after the first confirmed case of coronavirus in Lithuania.
Explanation: The video was made in May 2018 in Romania, during a sale at a supermarket.

Text: Summer temperatures will make coronavirus disappear.
Explanation: Not enough is known about the coronavirus to prove this claim.

Text: "Spanish newspaper ABC reports there are two possible COVID-19 cases in Gines and Benecaz¬¢n (Seville, Spain).
Explanation: ABC has not published this article

Text: A man with a gas mask at a supermarket in Lugo (Galicia, Spain).
Explanation: The photo was taken in Austria, not Spain.

Text: The wife of a Chinese shop owner in Totana (Murcia, Spain) has coronavirus.
Explanation: The claim is not true.

Text: Authorities should implement temperature tests to travelers from China.
Explanation: There is no evidence the tests are precise enough to detect infections with no fever.

Text: Video of a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police.
Explanation: This video shows a drill. It was shot 2/21/20 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.

Text: Barcelona's council issued a notification of a new focus in two neighborhoods.
Explanation: The council denied the claim on its Twitter account.

Text: The wife of a Chinese shop owner in Totana (Murcia, Spain) has coronavirus.
Explanation: The claim is not true.

Text: Clients of a brothel in the Spanish city of Valencia are quarantined after one of their employees tested positive for coronavirus.
Explanation: The claim is not true; it is a humor article.

Text: A man with a gas mask at a supermarket in Lugo (Galicia, Spain).
Explanation: The photo was taken in Austria, not Spain.

Text: Election years in the United States coincide with major disease outbreaks.
Explanation: Several years of discovery or the associated spread of a disease do not match election years, national and international health organizations said.

Text: Florida man is arrested for robbery using cough as a weapon.
Explanation: The photo was created using a prank generator site.

Text: A "poll finds 38% of Americans say they will not drink Corona beer because of the virus."¬ù
Explanation: The poll was conducted by a PR firm which did not release full details about it.

Text: "The coronavirus has made it to Mississippi and the lady that caught it wasn't around anybody with it, which means it is airborne. If the wind blows it in your direction, you'll have it also."¬ù
Explanation: According to the CDC and Mississippi, there are no confirmed COVID-19 cases in the state as of 2/28/20. Researchers believe the disease is spread person to person.

Text: "Every election year has a disease"¬ù?  SARS in 2004; avian flu in 2008; swine flu in 2010; MERS in 2012; Ebola in 2014 and 2018; Zika in 2016 and the coronavirus in 2020.
Explanation: Most of these diseases were discovered and spread before the election years and were minimally mentioned during campaigns. SARS, avian flu and MERS had virtually no effect on the U.S. during election years.

Text: Germany gave medical protection equipment like masks to China, now it's missing in Germany.
Explanation: Germany sent protection equipment to China twice in February.

Text: The coronavirus is more dangerous for animals than for humans.
Explanation: There is no proof that animals can get or spread the new coronavirus.

Text: A video shows people storming an Aldi supermarket to buy groceries because of coronavirus fear.
Explanation: The video was made in 2011 and shows people eager to buy laptops at an Aldi store in Kiel.

Text: This virus must be old because the label on a bottle of disinfectant from 2015 shows "coronavirus".
Explanation: The coronavirus family is known for decades, so older disinfectants  display its name.

Text: Russia announces the closure of airspace and suspends all incoming and outgoing flights to China.
Explanation: The Russian government had imposed a temporary and partial ban on the movement of Chinese nationals. All Russian airlines, with the exception of national airline Aeroflot, stopped flying to China on 1/31/20. Ikar airline will continue flights between Moscow and China. All planes arriving from China will be sent to a separate terminal in the Moscow Sheremetyevo airport. Aeroflot reduced the frequency of flights to Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou until 2/29/20.

Text: Garlic water can treat coronavirus.
Explanation: The WHO says there is no evidence to confirm this claim.

Text: Pangolin is the original cause of COVID-19.
Explanation: The information from scientists who first pointed to pangolin as the cause of the infection has been corrected.

Text: Doctors recommend carbon filter face masks to prevent coronavirus spread.
Explanation: Video claim is false. The FDA and CDC concluded they are not effective for children and are not recommended for home use. The videos are used to sell the masks to people concerned about the coronavirus outbreak.

Text: A video says the Vatican confirmed Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.
Explanation: The Vatican has denied the report, saying the pope has a "slight illness."¬ù

Text: President Barack Obama "waited six months to call swine flu an emergency after thousands died."¬ù
Explanation: The Obama administration declared swine flu, or H1N1, a public health emergency six weeks before H1N1 was declared a pandemic. No H1N1 deaths had yet been recorded in the United States.

Text: CDC recommends men shave their beards to be protected against the new coronavirus.
Explanation: The claim is based on a CDC chart created in 2017 to advise medical workers on the best practices for wearing a "filtering facepiece respirator" during contact with viral patients. It was not intended for the general public - nor specifically for preventing the spread of the coronavirus.

Text: Bill Gates is working on an electronic chip to implant under human skin in order to locate and control people.
Explanation: This is a common conspiracy theory, but Bill Gates never claimed working on this kind of project.

Text: Facemasks prevent coronavirus infection.
Explanation: Health authorities do not recommend using a face mask unless there is direct contact with a positive diagnosis.

Text: An alkaline diet can prevent coronavirus infection.
Explanation: No food or diet, alkaline or otherwise, can prevent the infection

Text: Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.
Explanation: The Vatican does not confirm this.

Text: "Florida hospital reports a coronavirus 'infestation' with multiple confirmed patients."¬ù
Explanation: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention presumptively confirmed two cases of the 2019 coronavirus in Florida.

Text: Photo shows a man wearing a "government issued Saint Laurent hazardous materials suit."¬ù
Explanation: The image was posted by a self-described parody account.

Text: "Shands Hospital of Gainesville, Florida, has confirmed its first case of coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: As of 3/2/20, the CDC has confirmed two cases of COVID-19 in Florida. Shands Hospital in Gainesville  has not confirmed a coronavirus case.

Text: Post says no one has died from the coronavirus in the United States.
Explanation: As of 3/3/20, nine people have died from the coronavirus in the United States. The first death was on 3/1/20.

Text: The coronavirus is "simply the common cold."¬ù
Explanation: The 2019 coronavirus is part of a family of viruses that produce illnesses ranging from the common cold to more critical diseases such as SARS or MERS. It is a new virus not previously identified.

Text: Oklahoma police planning to set up roadblocks to enforce a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination law and slap micro-chipped bracelets on people.
Explanation: A video featuring conspiracy blogger Greg Evensen is showing a speech from 2009.

Text: Plant-based cure for coronavirus discovered in Iran.
Explanation: The plant-based product has not been approved or submitted for approval to Iranian authorities, according to the official news agency.

Text: Disinfectant gel causes cancer.
Explanation: There have been no credible studies to prove this, according to health experts.

Text: Man critical with novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, India.
Explanation: There is no confirmed case of the novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, a town in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh.The man did not get infected with coronavirus in Barhalganj by consuming chicken.

Text: Alcohol kills the coronavirus.
Explanation: The claim is fake.

Text: Outbreak of COVID-19 is a worldwide fake. The fatality rate is too low for an epidemic. The WHO admitted causing the SARS outbreak in 2003.
Explanation: There are thousands of confirmed cases around the globe. The virus is confirmed in multiple labs. The fatality rate is greater than that of some of pandemics in the 20th century.

Text: Ambulance health care workers are transporting a coronavirus patient in The Hague (The Netherlands), dressed in white protective suits.
Explanation: Medical personnel and news websites had already stated this pati?¬Ænt was not infected with the coronavirus.

Text: The Ministry of Health in Spain issues advice about the coronavirus outbreak.
Explanation: The Ministry of Health has not issued an alert.

Text: 3.000 people from Elche (Spain) are infected with the coronavirus after coming back from Milan's international footwear industry fair.
Explanation: As of 3/2/20, there are no coronavirus cases in Elche; the Ministry of Health has not released a statement claiming any cases.

Text: The United States is "actually screening fewer people (for the coronavirus than other countries) because we don't have appropriate testing."¬ù
Explanation: The CDC has stopped publicly reporting the number of tests it's administered. As of March 4, the United States has lagged behind other nations in terms of coronavirus testing.

Text: A bovine coronavirus vaccine, for cattle, is proof that the novel coronavirus isn't "new"¬ù and is evidence of "how much the media controls people."¬ù
Explanation: The cattle vaccine has nothing to do with the COVID-19 virus.

Text: Journalist claims a coronavirus patient was murdered.
Explanation: The tweet did go out from a TV reporter, but was doctored to claim that a murder investigation was underway at the nursing home.

Text: U.S. Vice President Pence urged people with coronavirus to go to the police.
Explanation: This claim is false; Pence never said this.

Text: Post says "sanitizer will do nothing for the coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: Although they are not effective against all viruses, hand sanitizers with high alcohol content have proven effective against human coronaviruses.

Text: Post says two patients at Valley Regional Medical Center in Brownsville, Texas, "are being looked at"¬ù for possible coronavirus infections.
Explanation: Health officials say there are no coronavirus patients in the Rio Grande Valley as of 3/3/20.

Text: U.S. Senator Lindsey Graham says President Trump "probably knows more about medicine and specifically viruses than any of the so-called scientists at the NIH and CDC."¬ù
Explanation: Senator Lindsey Graham did not say this.The quote was fabricated by a Twitter account that has posted fake statements in the past.

Text: "Coronavirus hoax
Explanation: No credible evidence shows the current coronavirus spreading around the world was fabricated.

Text: People queue outside an Aldi supermarket in Germany to buy food in fear of the new coronavirus.
Explanation: The 2011 video shows the opening of an Aldi store.

Text: The photos show Indians bathing in cow dung to prevent infection.
Explanation: The photos show participants at an annual cow dung festival held in the southern region of India in October 2019, several weeks before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

Text: Images of BJP men smearing cow dung on one another after their party leader Suman Haripriya said cow dung may help cure coronavirus.
Explanation: Assam BJP MLA Suman Haripriya made those statements on 3/2/20. But the images are from the Goraihabba festival celebrated in Thalavadi (Tamil Nadu) on 10/30/19.

Text: This video shows dead coronavirus victims amassed in the Bergamo (or Brescia) hospital.
Explanation: The video was recorded in Ecuador at the Los Ceibos General Hospital in Guayaquil.

Text: Video claims that "The health system is collapsing"¬ù in North Macedonia.
Explanation: A false claim in the video 4/3/20 is that Macedonia has by far the lowest number of tested compared to other countries. Data for 4/4/20 shows Macedonia is the second country in the region in terms of the number of tests conducted for COVID-19 per million inhabitants. Another false claim is that the number of cases per capita is the highest in Macedonia from the entire region, but as of 4/7/20, the number of cases per capita in Macedonia is somewhere in the middle compared to the whole region.

Text: The CDC recommends men shave their beards to be protected against the new coronavirus.
Explanation: A 2017 CDC infographic shows how facial hair could interfere with respirator masks. The graphic is unrelated to coronavirus protection and the CDC has not recommended people should shave their beards to ward off the virus.

Text: You can't get infected by kissing the hands of a virgin or saint statue.
Explanation: Kissing the hands of a virgin or saint statue is a tradition of the Holy Week in some parts of Spain, but it is not free from viruses and therefore can be a way of infection.

Text: Drink (warm) water or gargle every 15 minutes to rinse the new coronavirus down.
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence that drinking warm water can prevent the new coronavirus.

Text: Ads are selling masks protecting against COVID-19.
Explanation: U.S. authorities don't recommend wearing masks and the doctor does not speak about COVID-19.

Text: An image shows Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer criticizing President Trump's restrictions on foreign nationals traveling to the U.S. from China.
Explanation: The tweet was fake.

Text: The government?  or specific states such as Michigan or Florida?  has mandated that employers and schools close for two weeks.
Explanation: No such announcement has been made.

Text: Pope Francis and his two aides have been infected with the new coronavirus
Explanation: The pope tested negative.

Text: A bovine vaccine can be used to inoculate people against coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no approved coronavirus vaccine.

Text: Patents mean deadly diseases and viruses were created or invented in a lab.
Explanation: The patents are for possible treatments or vaccines, some of which were tested but did not work.

Text: Bloggers say the Vatican reports that Pope Francis tested negative for the coronavirus before a second test came back positive.
Explanation: An Italian newspaper reported that Pope Francis tested negative for the coronavirus. The Vatican has not confirmed or denied the report.

Text: Video shows President Donald Trump saying COVID-19 is the Democrats' "new hoax."¬ù
Explanation: The video makes it look like Trump called coronavirus "their new hoax."¬ù There was nearly a full minute between when the president said "coronavirus"¬ù and "hoax"¬ù during a 2/28/20 rally in North Charleston, S.C.

Text: Vitamin C prevents coronavirus.
Explanation: Researchers reject that there should be any evidence to suggest that vitamin C intake can prevent COVID-19. With a healthy level of vitamin C, you can shorten a cold, but that does not mean that you can prevent or treat COVID-19 by consuming large amounts of vitamin C.

Text: The first dog was infected with coronavirus.
Explanation: A dog in Hong Kong was tested weakly positive for coronavirus but didn't show any symptoms so far.

Text: The coronavirus is a bioweapon by the USA, says German politician Wolfgang Gedeon in a Parliament speech.
Explanation: International scientists, the WHO and German Robert Koch Institute see strong evidence that the coronavirus is of natural origin and its outbreak is related to bats.

Text: Cow dung and cow urine can cure coronavirus.
Explanation: Dr Sumit Ray, a Senior Consultant, Critical Care Medicine, said that there are no scientific studies to support these claims.

Text: Consuming large doses of Vitamin C can stop the spread of coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no evidence that consuming large doses of Vitamin C cannot stop the spread of coronavirus.

Text: European Health Organization (EHO) announced that eating beef can cure coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no official institution with the name European Health Organization (EHO). Also, no authority in the European Union has announced that eating beef will cure coronavirus.

Text: Rapper Eminem contacted coronavirus.
Explanation: The post is a hoax.

Text: The first coronavirus case in North Macedonia was a well-known fashion designer.
Explanation: Due to the mass dissemination of the misinformation, Pandeva (the designer) addressed the public through a video message posted on her Facebook profile and denied that she was ill.

Text: New coronavirus was registered in 2018.
Explanation: It was another type of coronavirus that doesn't affect humans.

Text: A dog was quarantined in Hong Kong after testing positive for the new coronavirus.
Explanation: The information from the first case of the new coronavirus detected in a dog is true. On the other hand, there is a canine coronavirus that is different from the one that began to be detected in Wuhan

Text: Garlic, onions and other traditional medicine recipes are treatments against the new coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no evidence that garlic or traditional medicine can protect from the new coronavirus, according to the WHO.
Origin: Secretary of the National Security and Defense Council Oleksiy Danilov

Text: "With regard to the cost, let me be very clear
Explanation: Pence's claim over simplifies what is involved in making this coverage assurance because a large swath of private health insurance falls beyond these categories. His statement fails to acknowledge the need for action at the state level and from the private sector.

Text: The common cold is the only type of coronavirus.
Explanation: Coronaviruses can cause different illnesses in animals and humans, including the common cold. However, they can also lead to severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).

Text: Officials say coronavirus killed 200 in Iran.
Explanation: The number of deaths in official reports as of 3/3/20 were lower than stated in this article.

Text: "Man visited Albany, N.Y., days before dying from coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: The image was manipulated to look like it is from ABC News. There is no evidence one of those individuals who died from COVID-19 had recently been to Albany, N.Y.

Text: "The State of Florida has announced measures that all workplaces with 10 employees or more are to have paid mandatory leave to avoid the spread of COVID-19 coronavirus starting on March 6, 2020. All schools are to close for 2 weeks also from March 6."¬ù
Explanation: As of 3/5/20, Florida is not shutting down schools and businesses for two weeks.

Text: The media "pulled down an entire shelf of goods so that they can present the news of people buying stuff in a hysteria over the coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: An image claims to show a news reporter staging a shot of empty grocery store shelves. The photo is a hoax from Romania.

Text: "The Obama administration made a decision on testing that turned out to be very detrimental to what we're doing"¬ù on the coronavirus.
Explanation: The "decision"¬ù Trump talks about had its roots in a 2004 law, when George W. Bush was president. The FDA's policy pre-dated the Obama administration.

Text: The Obama administration "didn't do anything about"¬ù swine flu.
Explanation: The Obama administration responded with two emergency declarations, triggering billions in spending and other public health responses.

Text: Trump's effort to blame Obama for sluggish coronavirus testing.
Explanation: There was no "Obama rule,"¬ù just draft guidance that never took effect and was withdrawn before President Trump took office.

Text: Medical book states that coronavirus is just a common cold.
Explanation: COVID-19 is more dangerous than the common cold.

Text: Does France underestimate the outbreak?
Explanation: On social networks, many users claim that the number of coronavirus cases in France is underestimated, because there are fewer tests in France than elsewhere. This international comparison is not relevant.

Text: A confidential governmental document proves that the government has decided to postpone local elections in France because of the outbreak.
Explanation: This document is fake. The government did not make this decision.

Text: There is a connection between 5G and Covid-19.
Explanation: There is no proof that there is any connection between 5G and COVID-19 or that 5G can be harmful for people.

Text: UNICEF recommendations
Explanation: The message is misleading and has the potential to cause fear in India.

Text: A Shaheen Bagh protest in India was claimed to have coronavirus.
Explanation: Hospitals in Delhi confirmed that no Shaheen Bagh protest had tested positive for COVID-19.

Text: Runny nose and coughing sputum are not symptoms of COVID-19.
Explanation: In advisories issued by WHO, "runny nose" and "sputum production" are symptoms of COVID-19.

Text: Precautionary measures suggested by UNICEF.
Explanation: The viral message was not issued by UNICEF. Some measures suggested in the message contradict the WHO'S view on COVID-19 and have no scientific evidence.

Text: The WHO has issued an alert against buying holy colors from China
Explanation: The WHO hasn't issued an advisory against buying Holi colors from coronavirus-hit China.

Text: Precautionary measures suggested by UNICEF.
Explanation: The viral message was not issued by UNICEF. Some of the measures have no scientific evidence.

Text: A post says that there is a movie that predicted the pandemic and it's called "Coronavirus"¬ù.
Explanation: The image is false, is manipulated and it uses the cover of the movie "The flu"¬ù with the wrong title. There's no movie called "Coronavirus"¬ù.

Text: Article says that the Vatican confirmed that the Pope and two assistants have coronavirus.
Explanation: There's no official statement from the Vatican saying that Pope Francis is infected with COVID-19. Pope has felt ill, but not with the coronavirus.

Text: A patent that is being shared to claim COVID-19 is old.
Explanation: The patent is related to SARS, not COVID-19

Text: No work in several regions of Spain due to coronavirus.
Explanation: The link takes you to a picture of a monkey.

Text: 86 clients of a brothel in quarantine after a prostituted tested positive in coronavirus.
Explanation: This claim was a satire shared as real news.

Text: Vitamin C is a miracle cure for the novel coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no cure or special treatment for coronavirus as of publication.

Text: Shanghai government officially recommends Vitamin C for COVID-19.
Explanation: Intravenous high-dose Vitamin C has been used to treat patients with COVID-19 in certain Chinese hospitals, but it has not been recommended by the Shanghai government. .
Origin: Andrew W. Saul, Orthomolecular Medicine News Service

Text: Donating plasma or blood is free testing for the coronavirus.
Explanation: Currently the test for coronavirus is free.

Text: Novel coronavirus has a 99.7% survival rate.
Explanation: The CDC does not confirm this.

Text: The coronavirus test costs $3,200.
Explanation: Patients will not incur costs when tested by the CDC.

Text: Every election year has a disease; coronavirus has a contagion factor of 2 and a cure rate of 99.7% for those under 50 it infects.
Explanation: Every year in the U.S. is an election year, if taking into account midterm elections as well as presidential elections, and contrary to the claim, not every election year has had a disease outbreak. The transmissibility of the coronavirus, represented by the "basic reproduction number," is still under study. Currently, the basic reproduction numbers reported for the virus causing COVID-19 range between 2 to more than 6.

Text: The coronavirus outbreak is caused by 5G technology.
Explanation: There is no link between COVID-19 and 5G technology. The cause of the disease is proven to be a novel coronavirus. 5G technology uses low-energy radio waves, which do not damage DNA or cells unlike ionizing radiation

Text: President Donald Trump tweeted, "Coronavirus vaccine from Israel! Stock market up! Economy even stronger now! Besides US, Israel best at inventions
Explanation: President Donald Trump did not tweet this.

Text: Homeopathic product Oscillococcinum protects against COVID-19.
Explanation: The homeopathic medicine Oscillococcinum, which is sold against flu-like symptoms, is not recommended to protect against the coronavirus. That is pointless, even producer Boiron confirms.

Text: 38 % of Americans won't buy Corona beer due to the coronavirus.
Explanation: There is nowhere in the study that several media refer to 38 percent of Americans not buying Corona beer. Instead, it says 38 percent of 737 beer-drinking Americans will in no case buy Corona beer, but that doesn't mean it can be generalized to the overall population. There is also no indication that the lack of desire for the Mexican beer is due to coronavirus, as other media also writes. There can be many different explanations that 38 percent of the respondents do not want to buy the beer, for example that they do not like it.

Text: People who died after being infected by the novel coronavirus can't receive any mortuary care.
Explanation: The HCSP (Haut conseil de la sant¬Ç publique) told AFP not all mortuary care is forbidden for victims of the novel coronavirus. Embalming is forbidden but mortuary basic care can still be processed with additional precautions.

Text: Pope Francis contacted coronavirus.
Explanation: The Vatican confirms Pope Francis has not contracted coronavirus.

Text: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited Muslims to understand why they are not contracting COVID-19.
Explanation: The viral video is a combination of three clips of Xi Jinping visiting the northwest region of China in 2016.

Text: Aaj Tak channel aired a program that said drinking alcohol or smoking weed can cure COVID-19.
Explanation: Aaj Tak channel did not telecast such a program. The photos were taken from a fact-check episode debunking the claim and conclude that neither alcohol nor weed can cure COVID-19.

Text: Girl infected with coronavirus found dead in her apartment in Delhi.
Explanation: The incident in the post does not pertain to a coronavirus case in Delhi but is related to the death of a 22-year-old woman in Tamil Nadu's Chettipedu.

Text: Increasing border controls will stop coronavirus from spreading.
Explanation: Neither the WHO nor the CDC estimate that closing borders will stop the coronavirus

Text: Holding your breath for 10sec can determine if you have COVID-19 and you should drink water every 15 minutes.
Explanation: There are no medical and scientific evidences

Text: Medical Center in El Cachorro (Sevilla) closed due to a possible coronavirus infected person.
Explanation: The claim is false. Emergencies official channel of Sevilla denies it.

Text: Medical report of Hospital General Universitario Santa Luc¬°a de Cartagena (Murcia) from a person with possible coronavirus.
Explanation: The medical report is old, and refers to another kind of coronavirus.

Text: It is a designed virus ordered to laboratories by Christine Lagarde when she was in the IMF. She said that "old people live too long and this is a risk for the global economy. We must do something, urgently."¬ù
Explanation: There is no proof Lagarde said this.

Text: WhatsApp message suggests holding your breath for 10 seconds and drinking water every 15 minutes will fight the coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence of this.

Text: WhatsApp message suggests holding your breath for 10 seconds and drinking water every 15 minutes will fight the coronavirus..
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence of this.

Text: Bloggers say Nancy Pelosi delayed coronavirus funding so "Dems could campaign on it."¬ù
Explanation: President Donald Trump signed an $8.3 billion emergency spending bill to address the coronavirus on 3/6/20. There is no evidence House Speaker Nancy Pelosi delayed the bill for political ads.

Text: The mayor Of Buffalo told people to evacuate due to the coronavirus outbreak.
Explanation: The mayor denied this claim when he responded to a Facebook post spreading the misinformation.

Text: CDC sponsored Facebook post asking for help with "escaped"¬ù coronavirus patient.
Explanation: The post was created by a fake CDC account.

Text: If the coronavirus gets in your mouth, "drinking water or other liquids will wash them down through your esophagus and into the stomach. Once there, your stomach acid will kill all of the virus."¬ù
Explanation: There is no evidence that drinking water helps to prevent coronavirus infection. Health officials and media outlets have debunked the claim.

Text: "Anybody that wants a test (for the coronavirus) can get a test."¬ù
Explanation: The CDC says health care providers decide whether someone gets tested for coronavirus.

Text: People can't use the right of withdrawal at work because of the outbreak.
Explanation: French labor law experts say the risk of being infected with the virus at work can be a reason to refuse going back to work in some cases, but not all.

Text: Did the coronavirus mutate and became more aggressive?
Explanation: Chinese scientists discovered this coronavirus has two different types and that the second type could be more aggressive. But this is only a theory, never tested in lab and French scientists believe there no important mutation of the virus yet.

Text: Telangana Ministry in India distributed homeopathic tablets claiming to prevent COVID-19.
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence to support the claim that arsenicum album prevents coronavirus.

Text: Coronavirus patients are being caught on highways in China.
Explanation: The video is not about the coronavirus patients being caught, but of the training and mock drill given to the SWAT team in China.

Text: Cocaine cures COVID-19.
Explanation: The claim is false. There is no vaccine or medical treatment available for COVID-19. Cocaine is a stimulant and an addictive drug.

Text: Vietnam was the first country to contain and develop a quick test for SARS and COVID-19.
Explanation: The claim that Vietnam was the first country to contain SARS and develop a quick test kit is mostly legitimate. The claim that WHO says it takes four years to develop a test kit appears to be inaccurate.

Text: Consuming colloidal silver can prevent or treat novel coronavirus.
Explanation: U.S. regulators say consuming silver is not safe against any disease.

Text: As of 3/7/20, Tanzania and Zambia had confirmed fist cases of the new coronavirus.
Explanation: At the time, the MP said there were no reported cases in Tanzania. The WHO didn't confirm cases in either country as of 3/7/20.

Text: A Facebook post shared 25,000 times features an image of a letter purportedly from a U.S. hospital recommending people drink alcohol to help reduce the risks of novel coronavirus infection.
Explanation: Saint Luke's Hospital in Kansas City did not issue the letter, according to its staff.

Text: "More people have died from knowing Hillary (Clinton)"¬ù than from coronavirus.
Explanation: The claim is false.

Text: U.S. hospitals are preparing for 96 million coronavirus infections and nearly half a million deaths, leaked documents reveal.
Explanation: An infectious disease expert presenting to the American Hospital Association estimated there could be as many as 96 million cases of COVID-19 in the U.S. in a year. But there is no indication that hospitals are preparing for an outbreak of that magnitude, as this headline suggests.

Text: Elderberry syrup protects against the coronavirus.
Explanation: Elderberry syrup is said to improve the immune system, but this is not scientifically validated.

Text: 5G is accelerating the spread of the new coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no evidence that 5G Wifi networks are linked to the new coronavirus.

Text: An Italian doctor who worked at the Shenzhen hospital in China issued a series of instuctions for locating and treating the new coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.
Explanation: There is no medical evidence to suggest that the text circulation social media was authored by an "Italian doctor working in a hospital in China". Furthermore, these instructions are a collection of unproven hypotheses with no medical basis.

Text: A post has been shared on Facebook, Twitter and Whatsapp claims a regional government in India has recommended that the juice of bitter gourd, a vegetable often used in traditional medicine, is an effective treatment for the novel coronavirus.
Explanation: Indian authorities call it "absolutely false" and health experts said there is no evidence the vegetable is an effective remedy for COVID-19.

Text: Hot air application through a hairdryer on the face to heat up nostrils and the sinus kills the novel coronavirus.
Explanation: The claim is false.

Text: States are imposing mandatory leave and statewise school closures due to coronavirus.
Explanation: Though schools have closed since this announcement, at the time of its original posting, it was not true.

Text: Danish politician says Greta Thunberg gets special treatment in the European Parliament as she, despite the current outbreak, is allowed to speak.
Explanation: Greta Thunberg were treated specially when she were allowed to visit the European Parliament, although all visits were canceled. But it is not at all correct that all visits were canceled.

Text: The French health minister underestimated the risk of contamination in France.
Explanation: The French Health minister said that the risk of seeing the virus spreading in France was almost equal to zero, but it was at the very beginning of the outbreak in China and her statement was consistent with the data she had.

Text: A second version of the coronavirus is spreading and it is far more dangerous.
Explanation: Mutations of the virus exists, but it is uncorrect to claim that a "second version" would be more dangerous.

Text: Hundreds of Italian families are running away from the virus to Africa.
Explanation: There is no proof of this assertion.

Text: This laboratory is giving money to people who would agree to be infected with the novel coronavirus.
Explanation: This experiment pertains to another coronavirus and has no link with COVID-19.

Text: The headline of a newspaper with a phrase from the Bolivian chancellor about the coronavirus.
Explanation: The headline from the newspaper regarding the coronavirus is a photomontage.

Text: People of the Muslim community have prohibited visiting Mecca Medina to avoid the outbreak of coronavirus, but people of Sanatan religion are playing Holi at the crematorium of Kashi Vishwanath as a pyre.
Explanation: Mecca Medina of Saudi Arabia was not closed due to fear of coronavirus. There was a ban on the arrival of travelers from several countries. On 3/5/20 people were prevented from going inside because of sanitization.

Text: Video shows reciting Namaaz and Quran is the only treatment for COVID-19.
Explanation: The video is a "viral test" from Aaj Tak's show.

Text: UNICEF advises a certain set of steps to follow for coronavirus.
Explanation: UNICEF has not released this advisory and most of the claims are not scientifically proven.

Text: In an Aaj Tak news report, the Chinese prime minister said, "Reading Quran and offering namaz is the only cure for COVID-19."¬ù
Explanation: It is a clipped video of Aaj Tak's fact-check. In the full version, Aaj Tak debunked the claim and concluded that no such statement was made by the Chinese PM.

Text: Availability of a kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis.
Explanation: A Facebook advertisement selling surgical masks links to a webpage where they sell also a kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis. On March 9th there was no legal kit for doing coronavirus self-diagnosis. Only governament authorities are authorized to do it.

Text: Availability of a kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis.
Explanation: A Facebook advertisement selling surgical masks links to a webpage where they sell also a kit for Coronavirus self-diagnosis. On March 9th there was no legal kit for doing Coronavirus self-diagnosis. Only governament authorities are authorized to do it.

Text: Availability of a kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis in Italy.
Explanation: As of 3/9/20, there was no legal kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis. Only government authorities are authorized to do it.

Text: A kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis is available.
Explanation: A Facebook advertisement selling surgical masks links to a webpage for coronavirus self-diagnosis kits. As of 3/9/20 there was no kit developed legally for coronavirus self-diagnosis. Only government authorities are authorized to test for it.

Text: COVID-19 can be killed over 37 degrees Celsius.
Explanation: There is no confirmed information on what temperatures are dangerous to the virus.

Text: The Mayor of Skopje, Shilegov, returned from Madrid three days ago, and the government passed a decree requiring all passengers from Spain to be tested for coronavirus and placed in a 14-day quarantine.
Explanation: It is impossible to confirm the photo. The article includes misinformation. The government has not adopted a decree ordering all passengers who were in Spain to be tested for coronavirus and to be placed in a 14-day quarantine.

Text: Gang in Madrid is pretending to be doctors to steal from people's houses.
Explanation: Neither the National Police nor the local police have any complaints about this issue in Madrid.

Text: The bill for a coronavirus test in the US is 3.000$.
Explanation: The CDC is not making people pay the test by now.

Text: Viral claims propagating UNICEF message about coronavirus.
Explanation: UNICEF denied issuing the images.

Text: Coronavirus was caused by a mysterious vaccine activation distributed in China by chemtrails and activated by 5G.
Explanation: It is a combination of old conspiracy theories.

Text: EvAU's exam is postponed to June 18 in Madrid.
Explanation: Madrid's government has not made this announcement; the viral image is a set up.

Text: Spanish actress Cristina Pedroche has promised to show a breast if the number of coronavirus infections reaches 1,000 in Spain.
Explanation: The false claim is from a satirical website.

Text: This Lysol disinfectant against coronavirus shows the virus is not new.
Explanation: The disinfectant refers to the other types of coronavirus.

Text: A doctor named Lupita Yamamoto Lupercio found the coronavirus vaccine.
Explanation: The person pictured is Sandra Oh, an actress from "Grey's Anatomy." There is no vaccine against coronavirus yet.

Text: Madrid's government has announced students will have to make-up classes during summer.
Explanation: Madrid's government hasn't announced this and the shared photo is fake.

Text: Post says "President Trump has come into contact with a potential coronavirus sufferer!"¬ù
Explanation: There is no evidence President Donald Trump came into direct contact with a coronavirus sufferer.

Text: Says 80% of novel coronavirus cases are "mild."¬ù
Explanation: The website Information is Beautiful published a chart showing that 80.9% of novel coronavirus cases are "mild." But reports from the World Health Organization and the U.S. CDC found that mild cases account for 75-to-80% of all cases.

Text: Donating blood in the U.S. can get you a novel coronavirus test.
Explanation: The two organizations that collect the most blood in U.S. said they were not testing for COVID-19.

Text: Hand sanitizer will "do nothing for the coronavirus."¬ù
Explanation: The CDC says hand sanitizers with 60% alcohol can be used to prevent contracting and spreading the virus.

Text: Freshly boiled garlic water is a cure for coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no cure.

Text: Department of Homeland Security official says illegal border crossings may spread coronavirus.
Explanation: No officials were quoted to confirm this headline.

Text: A NYC Man With Suspected coronavirus Drops Dead in the Middle of the Street.
Explanation: As of 3/9/20, there were no confirmed deaths in NYC.

Text: Post says "being exposed to the sun for two hours"¬ù kills the 2019 coronavirus.
Explanation: There is no evidence that sun exposure kills the 2019 coronavirus. UNICEF has debunked a post that makes this claim.

Text: "(Former U.S. President Barack Obama) set up anti-pandemic programs in 47 vulnerable countries as a way to protect against something like the coronavirus. Do you know that Trump closed 37 of them?"¬ù
Explanation: News reports in early 2018 said the CDC was preparing to scale back its anti-pandemic programs in some countries because an early source of funding was running out and the agency didn't expect to receive new money from the Trump administration.The spending bills that lawmakers ultimately passed provided more money for those CDC programs than Trump's budget requests.

Text: "Coronavirus?  22. Clintons?  39."¬ù
Explanation: Conspiracies linking the Clintons to deaths are unsubstantiated.

Text: Flu vaccine does not increase the risk of a coronavirus infection.
Explanation: Some studies seem to show that the flu vaccine increases the risk of other viral respiratory infections, but a larger and more long-term study was unable to confirm these results.

Text: Antibiotic azitromycin cures COVID-19.
